A sweet happily ever after away from the villa?
By Lea Veloso
More stories by
If youâ€™ve watched Love Island UK Winter Season, you might be wondering: Which couples are still together from Love Island UK season 9?
Love Island UK, which is the original Love Island, premiered in 2005 on ITV, but it wasnâ€™t until it was rebooted in 2015 for ITV2 that it became the reality TV dating show we know and love today. Since it was rebooted in 2015, Love Island UK has aired nine seasons and led to dozens of international spinoffs in countries like the United States, Australia, South Africa and Spain.
The show, which is one of the highest rated series in the UK, has also led to real-life marriages and babies for couples who met as contestants such as season 2â€™s Cara De La Hoyde and Nathan Massey, who are married and share two children, and season 3â€™s Camilla Thurlow and Jamie Jewitt, who welcomed a baby in 2020.
So which couples are still together well after Love Island UK Season 9? Read more to find out.
Are Kai and Sanam still together from Love Island UK season 9? Yes, it appears the couple that won season 9 of the popular dating series are still together and very much in love.
They even pretended to get engaged when they appeared on BBCâ€™s Asian Network radio on March 20, 2023, which sent fans on Twitter into a meltdown. Kai shared a picture on Instagram of Sanam wearing a ring as he wrapped his arm around her, writing: â€œOMG did this just happen live on the @bbcasiannetworkâ€, with a link to the show. But the couple soon had to set the record straight; it wasnâ€™t a real proposal. â€œLol guys relax, it was a mock proposal,â€ one Twitter user wrote. â€œToday is national proposal day and they were just acting it out with the radio producerâ€™s ring. Kai and Sanam are still gf/bf.â€
In the season 9 finale, Sanam told Kai: â€œYou charmed me with your smile and melted me with your warm brown eyes. I was hooked by your intelligence, values, kindness and you always manage to make me laugh. Youâ€™ve made me realize my worth and I canâ€™t wait for us to one day be official.â€ Kai added: â€œMy time here has been a dream since I met you. Sanam, youâ€™re one of a kind and Iâ€™m so happy to have you in my life because I adore you and canâ€™t wait to see what the future has in store for us.â€
In an Instagram post following their win, Sanam wrote a gushing tribute to Kai and thanked her fans for their support. â€œThe start of our love story. I canâ€™t thank you all enough for the love you have given us. It honestly means the world to me to see how much support we have received. The positive messages, the videos of our journey, the fan pages, I honestly feel so blessed and overwhelmed with positive emotions I canâ€™t express it. â€œLove Island has been a beautiful experience for me and Iâ€™m so proud to say Iâ€™ve left with someone I love, admire, look up to, connect with on a deeper level and absolutely value and appreciate everything he stands for.
As mentioned, the couple walked away with a cool Â£50,000 in prize money after winning season 9 of Love Island UK and while theyâ€™ve expressed wanting to spend some of the money on a romantic vacation, theyâ€™re going to use their winnings sensibly as well. â€œI want to go to Italy. I want to go to the Amalfi Coast. Sanam wants to go to Santorini!â€ Kai explained, per The Mirror.
Sanam added: â€œWeâ€™ve got to be sensible with it as well.â€ The former teacher explained: â€œBefore I came in here I wanted to start up a business and help kids get into physical activity. I donâ€™t want to turn my back on teaching, working with young kids and think I will use some of that to do that. I am not sure yet in what capacity.â€ Sanam agreed: â€œThatâ€™s similar to me. I came from social work â€“ working with children who have been adopted. I know that sometimes in my area there can be limited services, so for me I want to be able to do something to aid and support them, being an advocate for them.â€
Kai is a science and physical education teacher from Manchester, England. He was an original Islander and entered on day one. â€œWhen you first meet someone you never normally get to spend that much time with them, so when youâ€™re genuinely looking for a connection, the villa is the perfect place to do it,â€ Kai told ITV in a press release for Love Island UK season 9.
He continued of what he thinks he brings to the villa, â€œIâ€™m pretty lighthearted, I love a laugh, Iâ€™m really calm and chilled as well, pretty level headed, quite matureâ€¦ but not too mature.â€ When asked why she thinks sheâ€™s single, Kai responded, Iâ€™m single by choice. Iâ€™m looking for the right girl. I feel like I have quite high expectations. I donâ€™t feel I should commit to someone unless Iâ€™m absolutely buzzing over them, because itâ€™s not fair on them.â€
Sanam, meanwhile, was cast as an Outsider in season 9, coming into the villa on day 29. She revealed sheâ€™s a very flirtatious, bantery personâ€ and â€œIâ€™ve been told Iâ€™m a bit of a tease,â€ she said. â€œIf thereâ€™s a guy I really have my heart set on, Iâ€™m very competitive.â€
Four days into her stint at the villa, Kai chose to couple up with Sanam and on day 36, they had their first one-on-one date. They had another date after that and on day 58, Sanam and Kai were chosen as the winners of Love Island UK season 9.
Are Lana and Ron still together from Love Island UK season 9? We havenâ€™t heard otherwise but we do know they were spotted in a heated argument the night before the showâ€™s big reunion. An onlooker explained to The Sun: â€œThey sat in the rain having a heated conversation for around 20 mins before finally going inside.â€ See the photos here.
A week prior, Love Island bosses were forced to intervene when Rob and Lana had a â€œheated rowâ€ while flying back to the UK from South Africa. They were so fuming they refused to film the â€˜meeting the familyâ€™ part of the reunion show at Heathrow until producers stepped in again, The Sun reported on March 16, 2013. â€œThey were due to stay overnight in London together but after the fight, they went back to their family homes separately to cool down.â€
After the finale, Lana took to Instagram to gush about Ron and thank fans for their support. â€œWeâ€™re home!!! Eeeeekkkkk ğŸ¡Weâ€™re completely overwhelmed by the love and support and just wanted to say a huge thank you to everybody who has supported us over the last few months,â€ she wrote in the caption of a photo of them posing together. â€œWeâ€™ve had the most amazing 8 weeks of our lives and now we get to live life in the real world together âœ¨excited beyond belief and canâ€™t wait to see what the future holds. Again, thank you everyone for literally everything, all the kind messages and support. We are reading as much as we can and getting back to as many as possible.â€
Are Shaq and Tanya still together from Love Island UK Season 9? Absolutely. The two recently posted each other embracing one another on their Instagram pages on March 16, 2023.
Shaq, for his part, posted, â€œI canâ€™t even begin to explain how thankful I am for the support, kind words and messages Iâ€™ve received. This has definitely been one of the best experiences of my life. Never in a million years did I think any of this would happen let alone reach the final! But Iâ€™m truly grateful for everything. As one chapter closes another one opens and I canâ€™t wait to start this new chapter with my beautiful girlfriend @talkswithtt_ â¤ï¸ So from the bottom of my heart I just want to say thank you!â€
Meanwhile, Tanya posted, â€œMy Right Handâ€¦ğŸ˜ Life together starts now! I have a best friend in my boyfriend I canâ€™t wait to fall deeper in love with you! If thatâ€™s even possible ğŸ¤­â¤ï¸â€
On the final date on the villa, Shaq asked her the question to be his girlfriend in such a romantic setting. Tanya confessed at first, â€œWeâ€™ve had a lot of ups and downs but I feel like the more that weâ€™ve gone through is what has made us to be honest. I feel like every time we were arguing, you were still in my head rent-free and then going through Casa Amor and you coming back and even when I had someone else, it was still always you. If all that stuff happened at the beginning, we would have cracked and broke. But I feel like weâ€™re over that now. I feel like we have gone through the worst, honestly and I feel like that has prepared me. I have found someone who truly cares about me. What a man!â€
â€œThe way I feel about you, I think itâ€™s only right that I want to make you my girlfriend.â€ Where Tanya replied: â€˜Ah! What? Stop! Are you sure?â€™ Shaq then said: â€˜Never been more sure,â€™ before Tanya again asked him: â€œAre you sure babe?â€ Officially asking her, Shaq finally exclaimed, â€˜Will you be my girlfriend?â€ It was an obvious choice for Tanya, â€œUm, yes!â€
On his first impression of Tanya, he told her, â€œWhen you first walked in, I was like â€˜Wow!â€™ And yeah, I was just tunnel-visioned for you from the get go. I know we had like bumps and stuff along the way and look, yeah, I messed up, I knew I was going to turn it around.â€ The two had their ups and downs while Tanya left him but eventually reunited and overcame Casa Amor, adding: â€˜And when you gave me that second chance, I was just buzzing. I wrote you a poem, it was a good little poem, that was. Weâ€™ve had a bit of a mad journey. Would I change it?â€
He continued, â€œNo, just because I feel like it has made us so strong. I havenâ€™t liked a girl like this for a long time. You know how big family is for me and I think it is the same for you. For me to have a girl get on with my sister is something that I would dream of. I can just picture you sat with my sister and I know you would just get on so well.â€
Shaq Muhammad is a 24-year-old airport security officer in London. On his elevator pitch when starting out in the villa, he said, â€œIâ€™m a great boyfriend. Iâ€™m very kind and thoughtful. Parents always love me. They say, â€˜Heâ€™s a good person, you should marry him!â€™ Once Iâ€™m with someone Iâ€™m always all about that person. Iâ€™m very vocal about that. Iâ€™m a catch!â€
Tanya is a 22-year-old biomedical engineer student as well as an influencer. On what she wanted to bring to the villa, she confessed, â€œIâ€™m super nice, but donâ€™t let it fool you. I want to be friends with everyone but if youâ€™re gonna be cheeky Iâ€™m the sort of person that will give it back. I will bring good vibes and good energyâ€
Are Tom and Samie still together from Love Island UK season 9? It seems like it! After placing third on the reality show, the two went home and were surprised by family and a former co-star. On March 17, the couple was surprised when they came into a house to see their family and friends welcoming them home with large T&S light-up letters in the entryway. Co-star Claudia Fogarty also posted about the coupleâ€™s homecoming. She posted on her Instagram stories, â€œSurprise @samieelishi @tomclare I wouldnâ€™t miss your coming home party for the world. Love you both so much and so proud of you.â€
Tom also posted the following morning on his Instagram stories to answer whether he had made things official with Samie yet, confirming that while not yet, she will be his girlfriend soon. â€œSamie will be my girlfriend very soon. We are very private people and itâ€™s something that we would make just us two but yeah, sheâ€™ll be my girlfriend 100%.â€
The duo headed to a private mountainside restaurant in a classic red Ferrari, driven by Tom for their final date. Tom referred to it as â€œthe best day of his life.â€ He told her, â€œWe are in it together, we have got each otherâ€¦there is no one Iâ€™d rather walk out that door with. I feel like Iâ€™ve met that person that Iâ€™ve been looking for. I feel like the feelings Iâ€™ve got for you feel so natural and nice, it is not easy for me to say, Iâ€™ll just be straight up, I canâ€™t lie, I am falling in love with you.â€
Tomâ€™s mom also gushed about her sonâ€™s appearance on the show to ITV. â€œWeâ€™ve loved watching him and not missed a night â€“ all of us couldnâ€™t wait for 9pm!â€ She continued, â€œSamie seems like a lovely girl and we are all looking forward to meeting her and getting to know her more. I just hope that she likes football!â€
Tom Clare is a 23-year-old footballer from Skelmersdale in Lancashire. He plays for non-league Macclesfield FC and was the teamâ€™s top scorer from the 2021/2022 season. He has been granted an â€œextended period of leaveâ€ to appear on the show, with the club saying that Tom had expressed an â€œunwavering desireâ€ to return after the show.
Samie Elishi is a 22-year-old senior estate agent coordinator from London. She is a self-professed â€œhonest personâ€ with â€œno filterâ€, and shared that she wonâ€™t be going down without a fight when it comes to an Islander she has her eye on. Sami said, â€œI wonâ€™t take rubbish from anyone, especially when it comes to guys!â€
If youâ€™re new to the series, hereâ€™s how Love Island works: The show starts with 10 or so singles who are invited to a villa on a tropical island with the hopes of finding love. Within moments of meeting each other, the contestants must couple up. As couples, the contestants are required to sleep in the same bed and complete challenges with each other, such as a classic Love Island game where they have to transfer food from their mouth to their partnerâ€™s. As the season continues, more contestants are invited to the villa, and islanders already there have to make a choice about whether to stay with their current partner or couple up with someone new.
Each week, thereâ€™s a re-coupling and the contestants who arenâ€™t in a couple are sent home. In the end, the public votes for their favorite couple among the finalists, and the winner receives a cash prize. On Love Island UK, that prize is 50,000 pounds. However, the money doesnâ€™t go to both members of the couple. It goes to one person at random. That person must then decide whether to share the money with their partner or keep it for themselves.
Are Will and Jesse still together after Love Island UK Season 9? It appears so! Farmer Will Young didnâ€™t last that far in the villa but he posted a picture of him and Jessie Wynter at his farm together.
He posted with the caption, â€œTo the Villa, to London, to the FARM. What a crazy, wonderful and life lasting journey this has been. We made friends for life, met each other and more importantly have fallen in love â¤ï¸ We are so happy that we got this opportunity as without it we may have never met ğŸ«¶ğŸ¼ We just want to thank all of you for the love and support we have gotten, we really couldnâ€™t have done it without you. Love you all Will & Jessie ğŸ¥°â¤ï¸â€
Are Olivia and Maxwell still together after Love Island UK Season 9? Yes, they are! They were coupled up during the Casa Amor stage of the show and were eliminated shortly after. Olivia posted a picture of her with Maxwell shortly before the season finale. â€œAftersun was so much fun ğŸ¤ğŸ«¶ğŸ»,â€ she captioned the Instagram photo. â€œThank you all for supporting me and Maxwell on our journey. Hereâ€™s to life on the outside ğŸ’•â€
Are Casey & Rosie still together after Love Island UK Season 9? Unfortunately, the surprise couple has broken up. After they were dumped from the villa, Casey answered a fan question on his Instagram stories, â€œRosie and I have spokenâ€¦sheâ€™s such a great girl. Life outside the villa is just very different and we will remain friends moving forward.â€
If youâ€™re new to the series, hereâ€™s how Love Island works: The show starts with 10 or so singles who are invited to a villa on a tropical island with the hopes of finding love. Within moments of meeting each other, the contestants must couple up. As couples, the contestants are required to sleep in the same bed and complete challenges with each other, such as a classic Love Island game where they have to transfer food from their mouth to their partnerâ€™s. As the season continues, more contestants are invited to the villa, and islanders already there have to make a choice about whether to stay with their current partner or couple up with someone new.
Each week, thereâ€™s a re-coupling and the contestants who arenâ€™t in a couple are sent home. In the end, the public votes for their favorite couple among the finalists, and the winner receives a cash prize. On Love Island UK, that prize is 50,000 pounds. However, the money doesnâ€™t go to both members of the couple. It goes to one person at random. That person must then decide whether to share the money with their partner or keep it for themselves.
Where is Love Island UK season filmed? All seasons of Love Island UK have been filmed in Sant LlorenÃ§ des Cardassar, Mallorca, in Spain, aside from season 6 and season 9, which were filmed in Constantia, Cape Town, in South Africa. Unlike the previous seasons, season 8 was filmed in a new villa in Mallorca. The season 7 villaâ€”which was first used in season 5 in 2019â€”is located on the Spanish Balearic Island of Majorca, in Sant LlorenÃ§ des Cardassar on the east side of the island. The villa included a super-sized hot tub, infinity pool, outdoor kitchen and terrace. In total, there were 73 cameras in the villa, which are placed near areas like the pool, the kitchen and the communal bathroom. The villa also has hidden microphones to catch what contestants say. The house also has a â€œbeach hut,â€ where contestants can speak to the camera in private. Fans can also stay in the villa, however, it will cost Â£3,000 for a week, according to The Sun.
Who is the Love Island UK season 9 host? Television and radio presenter Maya Jama is the Love Island UK season 9 host. ITV announced in October 2022 that Jama would replace Laura Whitmore, who left as the Love Island UK host after season 8. â€œIâ€™ve always been such a massive Love Island fan and Iâ€™m so excited to be hosting one of the nationâ€™s favourite shows! I canâ€™t wait to get into the Villa to meet all of the Islanders,â€ Jama said in a statement at the time.
â€œFinding a new host to follow the wonderful Laura Whitmore was never going to be easy. In Maya Jama though, we have another high-profile fan of the show whoâ€™ll be a great addition to the Love Island family. Cool, charming and charismatic, I speak for us all when I say Maya will also bring a unique presenting style to the show, as did Laura and, of course, the very much missed Caroline Flack. Weâ€™re very pleased to have her on board,â€ Paul Mortimer, Director of Reality Programming at ITV2, added in a statement.
Jama is an English television and radio host and DJ, who is best known for hosting BBC Oneâ€™s Peter Crouch: Save Our Summer in 2020 and BBC Threeâ€™s Glow Up: Britainâ€™s Next Make-Up Star since season 3. Jama also hosted 4Musicâ€™s Trending Live! from 2015 to 2017, ITVâ€™s Cannoball in 2017, and MTVâ€™s True Love or True Lies in 2018. She also hosted the first season of Channel 4â€™s The Circle. As for radio, Jama hosted Rinse FMâ€™s #DriveWithMaya from 2014 to 2017 and BBC Radio 1â€™s Maya Jama from 2018 to 2020. She also co-hosted the stations Radio 1â€™s Greatest Hits.
Whitmore reacted to news Jama was the new host of Love Island UK in a comment on the showâ€™s Instagram post announcing Jama in October 2022. â€œYes girl!! So delighted for you! Youâ€™re gonna be fab,â€ Whitmore commented at the time with a red heart emoji.
In an inteview with The Sunday Times in January 2023, Jama claimed that her young age prevented her from being hired as Love Island UKâ€˜s host sooner. â€œOnce you start doing TV, you meet a lot of producers through different shows, and the heads will be aware of talent. Thatâ€™s weird to call yourself talent, isnâ€™t it? I talk for a living. Itâ€™s not exactly tap dancing everywhere or performing a ballad,â€ she said. â€œSo I think Iâ€™ve always been in their eye-line, but I was super young when the presenter shifts were happening in the past. They knew about me but I was always a bit too young, and obviously, there were previous hosts anyway.â€
In a press release for Love Island UK season 9, Jama revealed how she learned sheâ€™d be the new Love Island UK host. â€œI was in New York. The first person I told was my best friend in Bristol. She wore loads,â€ she said. She continued, â€œI celebrated with different people each time. I celebrated with who I was around when I found out, then I celebrated when I got back to London. I feel like Iâ€™ll celebrate more after itâ€™s done, then we can be like, â€˜Yay we did it!â€™ rather than getting too excited before itâ€™s happened.â€
Jama also revealed what she loved about Love Island UK as a viewer. â€œIâ€™ve been a fan for years. It was my first reality show, other than Big Brother, that I made sure I was back at a certain time to watch and all my friends and family were speaking out,â€ she said. â€œEverybody gets involved, everyone has opinions â€“ from the older people in your family to the younger ones. Itâ€™s just fun, itâ€™s fun to see how people play out in different situations and wonder what you would do if you were in the same position. Most of us have had a bit of a holiday romance before and itâ€™s like watching that on telly.â€
Jama also explained what she thinks makes a good islander. â€œSomeone thatâ€™s looking for love, someone with a lively personality, somebody who is open and shares their feelings, but also someone thatâ€™s not afraid to keep their options open and test the waters. Just someone thatâ€™s willing to get stuck in and get fully involved in every bit of the experience and all the challenges. Make the most of it!â€ she said. â€œAnd allow it to be a proper test and see if your relationship can carry through that, rather than play it safe. I think thatâ€™s what makes the best islander.â€
Who is the Love Island UK season 9 narrator? The Love Island UK season narrator is Iain Stirling who has narrated the show since season 1. He is also married to former Love Island UK host Laura Whitford and also narrates Love Island US. In an interview with GQ in 2021, Stirling opened up about how his experience on Love Island UK has changed over the years. â€œIn previous years, it might have been, â€˜Redo this joke, please,'â€ he said. â€œThatâ€™s pretty uncommon these days because the producers trust us more [laughs]. Me and Mark, my writing partner â€” he works for ITV Studios in development and heâ€™s the guy who actually came up with the Love Island format, a 50-year-old Scottish vegetarian, really interesting guy â€” weâ€™ve just really got the tone down. Weâ€™ve also just started asking them beforehand, like, â€˜Can we say this?â€™ Saves us a lot of time. Now, itâ€™s things like, â€˜Can you say these peopleâ€™s names in a different order because theyâ€™re sat on a bed in this order?'â€
He also told the magazine about how he knew Love Island UK would be a success from the first episode. â€œGodâ€™s honest truth â€” the very first coupling. When I saw the footage of the very first, original coupling on Season 1, I was like, â€˜This is unbelievable,'â€ he said. â€œI couldnâ€™t believe how much I cared about everyone instantly. The first time a boy came down and they said, â€˜Step forward if you like him,â€™ and no one stepped forward I was like â€˜I canâ€™t not watch this, itâ€™s madness.'â€
He continued, â€œEspecially then, they were all such characters. Like there was this girl, Hannah, who was from Liverpool â€” and for an American, now that is a fuckinâ€™ linguistic journey. Her accent was unbelievable. And she was a former Playboy bunny, and she had this insane swimsuit on, and had had a lot of work done. Thereâ€™s a big thing with women in Liverpool, Scouse girls, on a Saturday you walk around a mall in Liverpool, every woman has got rollers in her hair, getting ready for a night out. She just had this massive blow dry, her hair was huge, platinum blonde, and she had these glass heels on. A builder from Essex got coupled up with her. I was just like, â€˜I love this.â€™ I loved it. I honestly loved it.â€
Despite his witty narrations, Stirling also told GQ that he would â€œneverâ€ hurt contestants on purpose. â€œNo, never. We were never told to make fun of the show. [Mark and I] figured that out ourselves. We just thought, if we make fun of the show first, other people canâ€™t really,â€ he said. â€œAlso, the only reason it works is because the showâ€™s actually quite good. Like with making fun of the dates, the Islanders can be at a rubbish table or whatever with plastic champagne glasses, but they still have to be on quite a nice beach.â€
He continued, â€œIf they were just in someoneâ€™s shitty backyard and it looked terrible, and I said â€˜thatâ€™s terrible,â€™ itâ€™s not funny. It has to come from a point of actually being quite good. If the show ever actually gets bad, we are in a difficult position, because itâ€™s not comedy if youâ€™re just saying somethingâ€™s bad that is bad. I think self-deprecation is also a very British thing. Iâ€™s very British to say, â€˜This is bad. Isnâ€™t that funny?â€™ Youâ€™ve got to say â€˜Iâ€™m shit,â€™ and then everyone will go â€˜Oh yeah, Iâ€™m shit as well.â€™ Thatâ€™s what Love Island does really well.â€
In an interview with The Arizona Central, Stirling explained how narrating the U.S. version of Love Island is different from the U.K. â€œI think the hardest thing will be the language,â€ he said. â€œI donâ€™t even know what you call it if someone mugs someone off. I donâ€™t even know what youâ€™d say. What do you call that in America when a boy is mugging you off?â€ He continued, â€œ(Phrases) like â€˜mugged offâ€™ werenâ€™t a thing before â€œLove Island.â€ So hopefully America will get to invent, sort of, their own vernacular and come up with our own little phrases and make it feel unique to them, do you know what I mean? I would love to get an American (version of) â€¦ mugged off, et cetera. So weâ€™ll see how it goes.
Though the slang is different, Stirling also confirmed that heâ€™s up-to-date on American referencesâ€”for the most part. â€œI think â€” and Iâ€™m sure Americans do know this â€” but literally, like, half of our news feed is American news, American politics. If you go to the politics section of the BBC website, half of it will be U.S. politics,â€ he said. â€œCulturally, I think, weâ€™re sort of all right. All the TV shows, I sort of get. The sports, I donâ€™t understand. I donâ€™t get that. Basketball is cool. But why is soccer not the best sport? Itâ€™s mad; itâ€™s the best game. Itâ€™s so good.â€
He also told The Arizona Central about what itâ€™s like to narrate Love Island US and UK at the same time. â€œItâ€™s a bit wild, and Iâ€™m very fortunate because the people at Peacock are sort of, like, very aware of how full-on it is, and theyâ€™ve done everything to make it possible that I can do this and sort of do things like, you know, sleep and see my family and eat, things like that. Everythingâ€™s in LA for the American show, apart from the writing team,â€ he said. â€œWeâ€™ve basically got two huts next to each other, and me and Mark (Busk-Cowley) will write the British one. And then the second we finish recording that, we go into the American room â€” I was going to say office, but that makes it sound too good â€” and go inside the American box. Weâ€™ll help those guys write what theyâ€™ve written so far and sort of let them know things we would and wouldnâ€™t say. And also we learn stuff, like Americans donâ€™t know what grafting is! I found this out today.â€
